title: Data Exodus Strikes
outcome: Thousands of angry residents coordinate a massive 'data strike,' scrambling or erasing their BCI data and vanishing from official tracking. The BCI system buckles, causing service chaos. Council members are forced into emergency negotiations, while solidarity grows among ordinary citizens using civil disobedience to disrupt the system.

events.description: Enraged by false amnesty, thousands launch a citywide 'data strike,' deliberately scrambling or deleting their BCI profiles to avoid surveillance.
Public transit, health, and food services experience widespread disruption as BCI-driven identity checks fail for a growing population of 'ghost' citizens.
Council factions blame each other over the loss of BCI control. Directorate proposes emergency measures, while Harmonists call for open talks with strikers.
Citizen-made murals and digital art appear citywide, celebrating the 'invisible' and mocking BCI authority. New symbols of solidarity spread through neighborhoods.
Facing unstoppable public pressure, Council agrees to negotiate with underground organizers, as doubts grow about BCI’s future viability.
